captions.text: OK.

Today, I'm going to demo the
fall through French braid.

This is a little bit different
French braid and you'll see,
as I go along, why.

But I've already
straightened her hair
so that it's nice and flat.

I like the way that this French
braid looks better in straight
hair, so I straighten my girl's.

But if you don't
want to do that,
you can do it on curly, as well.
So I start at the top.

Just gather enough hair
to do three strands,

just like a typical
French braid,
and divide into three sections.

This is all exactly
the same so far.

Then you're going to
cross the strands.

And now when you go to
pick up hair at the top,

just pick it up like normal
and add it into that piece
and switch it.
Here's the only difference.

When you get to
the bottom, rather

than adding hair into
this bottom piece,

you're going to have
her hold it and you're

going to pick up hair and
create a separate strand
and then add that strand in.

So instead of adding it,
you create a new one.

So come back up to the top
and add hair in, like normal.
Switch places.

And then again, have her
hold the bottom strand.
Pick up hair.
And create a new strand.
And you just keep doing that.
Add hair in at the top.
Have her hold the bottom.
Pick up new hair.

And you'll see what
happens in just a minute.
Add in new hair at the top.

Have her hold the bottom
piece out of the way.
Pick up new hair and add it in.
Pick up hair at the top.
Add it in.
Have her hold the bottom piece.

When you get far enough
back on the head,

then I just quit and just
create a normal braid
at the end to rubber band off.

So on hers, I'm just
going to braid it

down just a little bit,
and then add a rubber
band at the bottom.

And then have her let these
hairs down and brush them out.

And what you can see is that
it creates kind of a fall

through appearance from those
hairs that you released.

And you can see it just
looks just a little bit

different than a
regular French braid,

but I think it's really
cute and people really

comment on it because
it is different.

And then just add
a little hairspray
and you're ready to go.

One thing to keep
in mind with this

is because these hairs aren't
really super secure-- you could

see they're fairly loose--
just keep that in mind.

If she's going to have a day
where she's running around

a ton, that might not be the
perfect hairdo for that day.

title: Waterfall Braid {Plait} | Popular Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
